title: Senior R&D Researcher - Biologics & mRNA - R&D - EVA Pharma - October - Egypt
company_info: Join EVA Pharma: A Global Leader in Healthcare Innovation! At EVA Pharma, we fight for health and well-being as a fundamental human right, using innovation to address unmet medical needs worldwide. Led by a diverse and experienced team, EVA Pharma operates across branded generics, vaccines, OTC products, food supplements, herbal medicines, and veterinary products, and has a presence in over 40 countries. As one of the fastest-growing pharmaceutical manufacturers in the MENA region, EVA Pharma is transforming the future of healthcare.
job_summary: We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Senior R&D Researcher - Biologics & mRNA to join our team
experience: At least 2 years of Proven hands-on experience in Bioprocess research for the aim of developing biotherapeutics
description: Lead experimental design and execution of research projects focused on biologics and mRNA therapeutics, aligning with EVA Pharma's strategic R&D objectives.
Develop and optimize bioprocesses for the production of therapeutic proteins, mRNA vaccines, and other biologics using mammalian and microbial expression systems.
Conduct analytical method development and validation for product characterization, including identity, purity, potency, and stability testing.
Drive scale-up activities from lab-scale to pilot-scale, including tangential flow filtration (TFF), chromatography, and formulation processes.
Collaborate cross-functionally with upstream, downstream, and analytical development teams to ensure seamless project progression and knowledge transfer.
Stay abreast of the latest advancements in biologics, mRNA platforms, and regulatory guidelines to integrate innovation into EVA Biologics' pipeline.
Prepare technical reports, SOPs, and documentation in accordance with regulatory requirements and internal quality standards.
Mentor junior researchers and contribute to a culture of scientific excellence, collaboration, and continuous improvement within the team.
Present research findings to internal stakeholders, and contribute to scientific publications, patent filings, or conference presentations as appropriate.
Participate in troubleshooting and problem-solving efforts to address technical challenges encountered during R&D activities.
requirements: Bachelor's degree in pharmaceutical sciences, molecular biology, biotechnology, biochemistry, immunology, or a closely related field.
Familiarity with mRNA technology and different vaccine platforms; protein subunit, and viral vectors a plus.
Expertise in mammalian cell culture (development, banking, growth optimization), transfection, cryopreservation, and ideally microbial fermentation.
The ability to design, execute, analyze experiments, and understand statistical design (DoE) and multivariate data analysis.
A strong background in developing, qualifying, and validating analytical methods for biologics characterization (purity, identity, potency) following ICH guidelines.

Experience in biomolecule purification such as protein / mRNA / plasmid DNA (crossflow/tangential flow filtration, column chromatography skids), viral clearance studies, and ideally polymer/LNP formulation and scale-up.
Excellent analytical and critical thinking skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English, with the ability to present complex scientific data effectively.
A results-oriented mindset and the ability to thrive in a team environment.
Resilience, a strong work ethic, and the ability to multitask effectively.
An open mind and a commitment to a collaborative and transparent work culture.
